invited_talks.name: Finding Shortest Path in Dynamic Large-scale Graph, based on Lambda Architecture
Monitoring and visualization of metric traces on GPU accelerated applications
invited_talks.summary: Here we present the newly added features of monitoring power, temperature, and utilization on Nvidia GPUs in HPCToolkit.

basics.label: Ph.D.  Student
basics.name: Dejan Grubisic
basics.summary: Full time geek and re­search stu­dent with a pas­sion for de­vel­op­ing great soft­ware, of­ten late at night.

education.summary: Developed infrastructure for scalable GPU profiling over many GPU nodes. Added support for measuring performance counters and node level metric in HPCToolkit, as well as GPU-idleness analysis, which points the cause of serialization in GPU code.
education.thesis: Performance measurement, analysis and optimization of large scale applications

education.summary: Developed the system for detecting the shortest path from multiple source in large-scale dynamic graph based on Lambda Architecture. Technologies used: Spark, HDFS, Kafka, Python Dash, Docker, Python
education.thesis: Finding Shortest Path in Dynamic Large-scale Graph, based on Lambda Architecture

education.summary: FPGA implementation of chess board evaluation by following RTL methodology. Technologies used: C, SystemC, VHDL, SystemVerilog

publications.authors: Keren Zhou, Laksono Adhianto, Jonathon Anderson, Aaron Cherian, **Dejan Grubisic**, Mark Krentel, Yumeng Liu, Xiaozhu Meng, John Mellor-Crummey
publications.name: Measurement and Analysis of GPU-accelerated Applications with HpcToolkit
publications.summary: To address the challenge of performance analysis on the US DOE’s forthcoming exascale supercomputers, Rice University has been extending its HPCToolkit performance tools to support measurement and analysis of GPU-accelerated applications.

publications.authors: Aaron Thomas Cherian, Keren Zhou, **Dejan Grubisic**, Xiaozhu Meng, John Mellor-Crummey
publications.name: Measurement and Analysis of GPU-Accelerated OpenCL Computations on Intel GPUs (under submission)
publications.summary: In this paper, we describe extensions to Rice University's HPCToolkit performance tools that support measurement and analysis of Intel's DPC++ programming model for GPU-accelerated systems atop an implementation of the industry-standard OpenCL framework for heterogeneous parallelism on Intel GPUs

publications.authors: Keren Zhou, Xiaozhu Meng, Ryuichi Sai, **Dejan Grubisic**, John Mellor-Crummey
publications.name: An Automated Tool for Analysis and Tuning of GPU-accelerated Code in HPC Applications
publications.summary: In this paper, we describe GPA, a performance advisor that suggests potential code optimizations at a hierarchy of levels, including individual lines, loops, and functions. To gather the fine-grained measurements needed to produce such insights, GPA uses instruction sampling and binary instrumentation to monitor execution of GPU code. sing GPA, we obtained speedups on a Volta V100 GPU ranging from 1.01x to 3.58x, with a geometric mean of 1.22x

publications.name: Sistem za pronalazenje najkrace putanje izmedju lokacija sa tezinama putanja promenjivim u realnom vremenu zasnovan na arhitekturi lambda
publications.publication: [Zbornik radova Fakulteta tehničkih nauka u Novom Sadu](http://www.ftn.uns.ac.rs/ojs/index.php/zbornik/article/view/707)
publications.summary: Finding shortest path in dynamic multi source large-scale graph, based on Lambda architecture

work.summary: Working on development of [HPCToolkit](http://hpctoolkit.org/), large-scale profiling tool used widely accross US national labs. Curently implemented infrastructure for scalable GPU tracing, node-level metric tracing, performance counters, and various performance analysis.
Profiling and analysis of power consumption on multi node GPU applications by using Nvidia [NVML library](https://developer.nvidia.com/nvidia-management-library-nvml).
Teaching undergraduate and graduate compiler construction course
Optimization of [MADNESS](https://arxiv.org/abs/1507.01888) (Multiresolution Adaptive Numerical Environment for Scientific Simulation) in [Intel CnC](https://icnc.github.io/) framework.

Profiling and Analysis of FFT implementation on [Xtensa Platform](https://www.cadence.com/en_US/home/tools/ip/tensilica-ip/tensilica-xtensa-controllers-and-extensible-processors.html) in C and theoretical analysis window functions.
Measuring and characterization of materials on micro-identer device
